reasoning: Fact 1: The witness claims he saw shadows on the ritual curtain.
Fact 2: The evidence suggests the moon was directly above the summit of Mt. Poniponi.
Fact 3: The context suggests the witness was at the top of Mt. Poniponi.
Prop 1: If a light source is directly above an observer, it will cast shadows of an observed object on the opposite side of the observer.
Prop 2: If the observed object is surrounded by curtains, an outside observer cannot see the shadows cast on the opposite side of the curtains.

testimony.testimony: That's why my name doesn't appear on the hold entry record.

gold.testimony: In the hold, I hid the still-warm body in the spare Pegabull lantern.

testimony.testimony: In the hold, I hid the still-warm body in the spare Pegabull lantern.

source.evidence_span: There's a bloodstain on the inside wheel handle, as if somebody gripped it with a bloody hand.
source.testimony_span: I hid the still-warm body in the spare Pegabull lantern
source.explanation: The bloodstain on the inside wheel handle suggests the person put inside was still alive.

gold.testimony: I was always in the company of others. I didn't have the opportunity to murder Gloomsbury.

testimony.testimony: I was always in the company of others. I didn't have the opportunity to murder Gloomsbury.

source.evidence_span: Much of the reception hall is obscured by thick fog.
source.testimony_span: I was always in the company of others. I didn't have the opportunity to murder Gloomsbury.
source.explanation: Even if the witness was in the company of others, he would have the opportunity to commit murder given the thick fog.

gold.testimony: The black-uniformed varsity cadet fired on the English civilian! And from the back, the cowardly little weasel!
The black-uniformed varsity cadet fired on the English civilian! And from the back, the cowardly little weasel!

testimony.testimony: I was ingesting a regulation beef steak at the restaurant while having a tactical discussion with the old man.

gold.testimony: Indeed. Alone, he was, the Englishman. Dining all by himself.

testimony.testimony: Indeed. Alone, he was, the Englishman. Dining all by himself.

gold.testimony: 'I ordered a beef steak for myself, and the professor and I said "cheers" over a glass of carbonated water.'

testimony.testimony: 'I ordered a beef steak for myself, and the professor and I said "cheers" over a glass of carbonated water.'

gold.testimony: If there's some other way a man's life can been [sic] taken without leaving a trace, please, do show me.

testimony.testimony: When the waiter brought my steak, the professor and I raised our glasses in a toast.

gold.testimony: D'you think I'd forget the sight of those blood-soaked hands after that butcher stabbed the man?!

testimony.testimony: I tell you, I saw McGilded stabbing that man! Everything I said before stands!

gold.testimony: Anyway, the fact remains! There can't have been anyone else inside that carriage, or we all would have seen!

testimony.testimony: There was blood on both hands of the assailant. I sincerely and distinctly remember that!

gold.testimony: If you're so sure the victim fell through the skylight, where's your proof?

testimony.testimony: The skylight was shut the entire time, I tell you! We couldn't possibly have opened it!

gold.testimony: He was on his way home from Bourbon Books, a secondhand bookshop he apparently patronises.

testimony.testimony: Out of the blue, the victim was stabbed from behind and subsequently collapsed on the pavement.

gold.testimony: I could even tell you the names of the four books he dropped at the scene.
I could even tell you the names of the four books he dropped at the scene.

testimony.testimony: We ran straight over of course, and then went for help at a nearby police box.

gold.testimony: I didn't take my eye off the crime scene for one moment, sah! Nothing strange to report on that front, sah!

testimony.testimony: You see - SAH! - the windows on the top floor of the Garrideb house are top-hinged casements.

gold.testimony: If that bally thing in the victim's back really was one of ours, you'll have a job proving it, I think.

testimony.testimony: Plenty of knives around our place. Can't say I'd notice if one or two went missing, I'm afraid.

gold.testimony: The bloke wot owned the place was 'oldin' a gun, so 'e should 'ave just fired instead of yellin' at the girl!
The bloke wot owned the place was 'oldin' a gun, so 'e should 'ave just fired instead of yellin' at the girl!

testimony.testimony: Just before the gunshot, we 'eard a voice yellin' out, 'Gimme that gun!'

gold.testimony: The bottom line is, I've never had anything to do with the pawnbroking establishment where the man was killed!

testimony.testimony: Even if certain parties here present claim that my blood was found at the scene.

gold.testimony: In other words...I had absolutely no reason to break into the shop later that same night.

testimony.testimony: In the end, of course, the disk was taken by the police.

gold.testimony: It was some low-class brickmaker negotiating with McGilded anyway, was it not? I've no relation to the man!

testimony.testimony: 'Milverton & Skulkin's Milk Run'... Gor, them were the days!

gold.testimony: I pursued the man but he shut himself in the storeroom. I could see him through the peephole in the door, though.
Then she tossed the gun out of the peephole. So I picked it up...and made my escape.

testimony.testimony: I pursued the man but he shut himself in the storeroom. I could see him through the peephole in the door, though.

gold.testimony: I saw blood on the blade. It proved to me that she'd stabbed the victim multiple times.

testimony.testimony: I ran into the beach hut at once, where I found the pair in question.

gold.testimony: In other words, there's no good reason why the defendant would have tried to pull the knife from the victim.

testimony.testimony: Let's not forget that the young student did have a motive for killing the victim.

gold.testimony: I never once set foot in the hut, nor spoke with the Englishwoman. I was there only as an observer.

testimony.testimony: My smouldering journo spirit burst into flames! Quick as a flash, I whipped out my camera ready to click!

gold.testimony: Because why would I have bothered to stab the woman if I'd already poisoned her?
The point is...if you'd poisoned someone, there'd be no reason to then go and stab the person as well!

testimony.testimony: When I heard the student girl and that pompous English murderer arguing...it got my goat.

gold.testimony: The victim would have been perfectly able to lock the door after his guest left. The argument still stands.

testimony.testimony: Argh! My tea was completely harmless! He couldn't have locked the door behind me otherwise, could he?

gold.testimony: The meter doesn't appear to have been tampered with, though, and the collection agent has the only key.
The meter is designed for coins the exact diameter and thickness of a thruppenny bit. Nothing else will fit.

testimony.testimony: The meter doesn't appear to have been tampered with, though, and the collection agent has the only key.

gold.testimony: Whilst feigning distraction in our debate, ne'er did a drop of his own drink pass his lips.

testimony.testimony: When he departed by and by, I did use the tea that remain'd in his cup to make my coins of ice.

gold.testimony: This note was delivered to me at my address. It's nothing to do with the odd man next to me here.
This note was delivered to me at my address. It's nothing to do with the odd man next to me here.

testimony.testimony: It was the first time I'd been in the area. I had a little matter to attend to, that's all.

gold.testimony: I don't know what you mean. You think I snuck into this man's room, do you? Why would I?

testimony.testimony: I don't know what you mean. You think I snuck into this man's room, do you? Why would I?
